title: Kevin White 2014 La Fraternité Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Grenache (60%), Mourvèdre (32%) and Syrah hailing from the Upland, Boushey, and Sugarloaf vineyards. It opens with enticing aromas of citrus peel, smoke and peppery spices, with red and black fruit lurking in the background. It's full bodied but still remarkably fresh, showing luxurious dark-fruit flavors that linger on the smooth, elegant finish.

title: Doren 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick, soft and extracted, this 100% varietal, estate-grown wine is lovingly made, with very little of it produced, so tiny is the site. Red currant, cherry, sage and cedar ride a dusty undertone of grippy tannin that softens in the glass.

title: Fowles Wine 2014 Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Victoria)
description: One of Fowles' best efforts, this wine shows ample vanilla and toast influences from oak, but those elements play a necessary role in supporting and defining the ripe peach and melon fruit. This is medium to full in body, with a soft, pillowy texture and a long finish.
designation: Ladies Who Shoot Their Lunch Wild Ferment

title: Fox Creek 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Full bodied, creamy and supple, this wine offers textbook aromas of cedar, tobacco and cassis. It brightens slightly on the palate, where cherry notes join the fun, then finishes long and softly dusty. Drink now–2028.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Aromatic, immaculate and showing crystalline clarity, this brings refreshing minerality and perfect balance to light but compelling fruit flavors of apple and pear. Skin phenolics also help to frame the wine, and the persistent length and superb definition are especially impressive.

title: J. Bookwalter 2014 Suspense Conner-Lee Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Merlot makes up just under two-thirds of this wine, with the rest Cabernet Franc. The aromas display a medley of fresh green herbs and flowers and cherry, while the palate brings poised cherry flavors that show elegance and persistence.

title: Gramercy 2014 The Third Man Grenache (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light in color, this wine brings initially reserved aromas of raspberry, herb and mineral, along with a light earthiness. The palate is broad and quite pure in style. It shows more flesh than the winery is typically known for but still has no shortage of elegance and balance.

title: Efeste 2013 Tough Guy Klipsun Vineyards Red (Red Mountain)
description: An equal split of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this wine opens with aromas of high-toned dried and fresh herbs and leaves, with red and black fruit lurking in the background. The palate is chock full of brooding black-fruit flavors, with this vineyard's often burly tannins there but in check. Still, some cellaring will be rewarded. Best after 2020.

title: Fulcrum 2014 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Frozen strawberry and black-raspberry sorbet elements mesh with sandalwood spice and a cinnamon-chiffon touch on the elegant nose of this bottling. The palate struggles to match that aromatic excitement, but does offer tightly wound raspberry, slate and thyme touches. This will age for years.

title: Yalumba 2013 The Strapper G-S-M (Barossa)
description: Full-bodied, lush and supple in the mouth, this blend of 40% Grenache, 38% Shiraz and 22% Mataro is the Australian version of a barbecue wine, bursting with rich, ripe fruit. Chocolate, mocha and plum shadings dominate, ending on a soft, warm note. Drink now–2020.

title: Yangarra Estate Vineyard 2013 G-S-M (McLaren Vale)
description: Full bodied and richly tannic, this gives lie to the notion that all Grenache-based blends are easy quaffers. Dried spices and mixed berries include hints of clove and cracked pepper, finishing with some dry, chewy tannins. The assemblage is 49% Grenache, 29% Shiraz and 22% Mourvèdre. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Zorzal 2012 Piantao Red (Tupungato)
description: This Cabernet Franc blend opens with herbal oaky aromas of coffee and red fruits. The palate feels tartaric and shocking, with heavy extraction and an overall wiry feel. Jacked-up berry flavors come with more than enough oak, while this is steady but not finessed or elegant on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: William Hill Estate 2013 Benchmark Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, dense and juicy Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend, rich in currant, black cherry and blackberry. An approachable tannin structure allows for drinkability in its youth.

title: Château Haut Selve 2014 Réserve  (Graves)
description: The limited-release reserve wine from a 21st century winery and one of the best vineyards in the Graves was wood aged for 24 months. That has given it extra richness and spice along with the dense blackberry fruits. It is complex, ripe with great ageability. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Ampelos 2012 Rho: The Correlation Ampelos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a biodynamic-certified vineyard, this is wildly spicy wine, taut in acidity and sizable tannin. It shows a dark funkiness of baked plum, clove and leather wrapped in more vibrant hits of cherry and orange.

title: Andrew Will 2013 Two Blondes Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Merlot (44%), Cabernet Sauvignon (34%) and Cabernet Franc. Fragrant aromas of raspberries, orange peel, red currant and garden herbs lead to restrained but sumptuous fruit flavors backed by a lick of tart acidity. It brings a sense of presence and depth.

title: Bethel Heights 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Lush and forward, this lovely wine is bursting with red and black-cherry fruit. It socks you (gently) in the nose and seduces you in the mouth, with streaks of cola and a dash of pepper. No need to wait on this wine, as it is already drinking like a dream.

title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This dark tannic Malbec with ripe black-fruit aromas hits the right notes on the nose. In the mouth, things are tight and rubbery in feel. Salty blackberry flavors are rustic but balanced by a note of sweet marzipan. On the finish, this is dry, drawing and fiercely tannic. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2010 Monte Real Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of black fruits, integrated spices, licorice and tobacco are sturdy and almost heady. This feels layered, with structurally sound, slightly scraping tannins. Flavors of spicy cherry and cassis finish ripe, loamy and with a note of prune. Drink through 2020.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2013 Clave de Tábula  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Ripe berry aromas combined with oak, vanilla and coconut scents make for a full friendly nose. This feels choppy and abrasive. Woody flavors of coconut and black fruits finish full and tannic, which creates a raw blocky feel that time may tame. Drink through 2023.

title: Brian Carter Cellars 2012 Le Coursier Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Merlot (62%), Cabernet Sauvignon (23%), Malbec (6%), Cabernet Franc (5%) and Petit Verdot, this wine opens with aromas of cocoa powder, spice, dark cherries, savory herbs and flowers, displaying pleasing complexities. The palate is full of exquisitely balanced red and black-fruit flavors that sail off into the distance on the finish.

title: Château Paloumey 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: A structured, Cabernet Sauvignon-dominated wine that is already showing its ripe juicy side. It is already impressive, with its layers of butts as well as acidity. The black-currant fruitiness of the vintage is shining through. Currently performing well, this property is at the southern end of the Haut-Médoc region. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Château Tour Prignac 2014 Grand Réserve  (Médoc)
description: This is a ripe wood-aged wine drawn from a selection of barrels. Eucalyptus flavors go with the black fruits and solid tannins. The wine is dense, and still obviously very young. It is going to be an impressive ripe wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Vieux Cardinal Lafaurie 2012  Lalande de Pomerol
description: This is a full-bodied wine, perfumed by its 25% Cabernet Franc and given a juicy fruitcake character by the smooth Merlot. It does still retain a crisper juicy acidity that will develop well as it ages over the next few months. Drink from late 2017.

title: College Cellars 2014 Summit View Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine comes from an up-and-coming region (and vineyard) of the valley. Unique aromas of herb, sage, vanilla, high tone spice and dark fruit are followed by ripe, generous, pitch black fruit flavors. It's high up on the hedonistic scale.

title: Dr. Loosen 2014 Red Slate Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pristine grapefruit, lemon and tangerine notes are accented by whiffs of blossom and slate in this elegantly composed dry Riesling. The palate is juicy with penetrating citrus flavor, yet it's dazzling minerality shines even brighter. The long, lime-kissed finish is exhilarating and electric. Drink now trough 2021.

title: Efeste 2013 Final-Final Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas bring a big whack of pungent blue and purple fruit, along with notes of herb and cherry. The flavors are full and palate coating, bringing a real sense of texture and hedonism but still with great freshness.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2013 Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This full-bodied beauty traffics in cigar, tar and chocolate, expressing a rich, robust and smoky world of goodness. With a velvety texture, it continues to impress beyond the first sip, offering both memorable length and breadth. It blends together 80% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Malbec.

title: M2 2014 Lani's Vineyard Syrah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Big and bold, broad in texture and deep in ripe, chocolaty flavors, this wine is full bodied. Rich in mouthfeel, it's almost sweet, and deftly made to be appealing now despite very firm tannins. It will be outstanding in a pairing with big proteins.

title: Macauley 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah, this old-vine powerhouse is juicy and sultry, with a hint of smokiness. Leather and bark add to the savory picture, while the tannin profile is decidedly soft and smooth.
